info.content: We went to Great Auntie Sue's and Great Uncle Richard's for a family New Year's party

• morningWe got up ridiculously early to go to Bromley for some sales shopping. Daddy, being a cheap skate found a hooky, residential car park.... but the car park barrier came down and he got our car locked in. The only way out was to go and ask one of the residents for a key, to raise the barrier. Daddy waited and waited for over an hour hoping a res dent would want to go out. In the end he knocked on someone 's door. Got them out of bed, to come and let us out!! What a plonker.
  • afternoonWe went over to see Michael's mum and sisters, before returning back home.

We travelled from Grandma's house down to Bexhill. It seemed to take forever to get there. It was so cold and windy and the waves on the sea were really big and came crashing onto the Beach. It was soooo fresh. We had some lunch in a small cafe, which seemed to be the only thing open in town. We had a lovely walk before returning back to Grandma's. We played games and watched TV in the evening

Christmas Day was spent opening presents with mummy and daddy in their bed. We later went to Farmor and Farfar's house to have breakfast. Oldemor was there to. Then mummy and I went to St. Andrews church for the Christmas service. It was so boring I slept. We then rushed over to Grandpop's and Grandma's where there was a Christmas lunch, and opened more presents. We had a walk around Istead Rise, played some games, watched some TV.

Daddy worked in the morning. We went over to Farmor and Farfar's in the late afternoon for our traditional Danish Christmas, where we are allowed to open some presents!! Yippee. We had Roast Pork, we played games, then we were allowed to open some of our presents. I think I was more interested in the wrapping paper than the presents themselves. I love to scrunch the paper and put it in my mouth. We ended up going home at about 11 o'clock.
With Daddy in front of the tree

title.value: Photo of Katie in front of the tree

info.content: Daddy made a special smoked salmon lunch for Farmor and Oldemor

• afternoonWe drove to Greenwich, walked through the park. It was such a miserable, rainy, windy day. Our umbrella 'blew out'. We went to see the Cutty Sark, then had lunch in a traditional pie and mash shop. It was packed with lots of people coming in from the cold. We then walked to the Maritime Museum. It wasn't very busy, but it was very modern. We only saw a bit, because I was getting grumpy and Daddy was a bit tired.
  • eveningAfter visiting Grandma and Grandpop, we went to the Sanders for a Christmas meal. It was lovely. We got a lovely Christmas Ball to hang on the tree.

title.value: Trip to Royal Maritime Museum and Sanders Christmas Meal

info.content: Ellie and Michael treated us to a meal at the Hungry Horse pub in Bagshot. We had huge meals.
Barrie, Laura, James and Emma came over to exchange Christmas presents. We had a really fun time.

• morningDaddy and Michael went to play football.
  • afternoonWe went over to scatter Great Grandpop and Nan's ashes next to Great Nan's parents graves in Tatsfield.
  • eveningWe went to Farmor's and Farfar's to see Oldemor who had just arrived from Denmark. It was nice to see her again. She brought some Danish pastries.

title.value: Oldemor arrives and Scatter great grandparents ashes

info.content: Happy on my changing mat. Chance to kick the leggies

• eveningWent to a pub in Weybridge to celebrate Tina and Alan's 21st wedding anniversary.

title.value: NE Holiday - Down to Great Uncle Phil and Great Auntie Emma's
NE Holiday - Down to Robin Hood Bay

info.content: The family

title.value: NE Holiday - Costal Drive to Berwick

info.content:
• MorningWalk along the coast and then watched World Cup Rugby
  • AfternoonDrive along Hadrian’s Wall
  • EveningSunderland

• MorningWalk along the coast and then went for a swim. First time with Daddy
  • AfternoonWatch Spennymoor V Droylsden football
  • EveningNewcastle city centre

I'm looking a bit worried

• MorningDriving
  • AfternoonVisited York
  • EveningEvening: Got to the Lighthouse's Keeper Cottage where we dumped the bags and went to Sunderland to see what was going down. The city centre was cold and empty. Had fish and chips for dinner

• MorningDriving
  • AfternoonVisited Andrew. George was at work. Went to very picturesque Bakewell. Always be remembered for the foggiest drive on the way home. Couldn't see the side of the roads.
  • EveningGot some wine in.... Andrew cooked up a pasta meal and we watched a film
I had another lot of immunisations today. Daddy and Uncle Michael went to pick up a bike from Limehouse station
Daddy went to the quiz night with Uncle Michael, while mummy and I stayed in at Ellie's

title.value: Out with Great Grandma and Granddad

info.content:
I'm looking curious

I'm looking a bit worried
After swimming we went over to see Laura.

first.value: My first play with a toy

title.value: Katie's first play with a toy

info.content: James and new-ish girlfriend Emma came over for the evening. Somehow we talked her into doing a mural on Katie's bedroom wall

• morningWe went over to Windsor for a nice walk through the town and along the river. We ventured into Eton a bit as well
  • afternoonJessica and john came over after their marriage classes. Dad then went over to Uncle Michael to play poker with the boys

title.value: Windsor and Jess and John over

info.content: Nice outfit
Got the look

title.value: See Auntie Vicky in Penarth, Cardiff

info.content: Saw Vicky’s new home. We went for a walk to Penarth pier in the afternoon, then had a nice night in

title.value: See Auntie Vicky in Penarth, Cardiff

info.content: Hello
We went to see Chertsey Town F.C. play. Me and mummy also went over to a Barn Dance that Grandma had organised. Not sure what Daddy was up to. May have been a card night

title.value: Chertsey Town F.C. and Barn Dance

info.content: ...at Frimley Lodge Park

title.value: Uncle Michael to stay for the week
Uncle Michael to stay for the week

info.content:
In the morning we went to Great Uncle Bob's funeral. He was a very kind and loving man. The proceeding went with the respect he deserved. We went for a bite to eat afterwards and saw all of the Weston side of the family, which was very nice

On our way home we had arranged to meet up with Claire and Georgia at their lovely little cottage. It was lovely to see how much bigger Georgia had got. We had a couple of cups of tea and a nice chat before heading back off home again.

title.value: Great Uncle Bob and Claire P

info.content:
You're 'aving a laugh

You're 'aving a laugh

title.value: Uncle Michael to stay for the week

info.content: Went over to see Farfar for his birthday
In the bath with Daddy

We continued our holiday in Dorset

These are the bands Daddy watched

  • The Zutons - first song was really good - then rubbish
  • Inspiral Carpets - dated
  • Morcheeba - chillin
  • PJ Harvey - can't remember
  • Queens Of The Stoneage - others enjoyed it. It didn't do anything for me
  • The Coral - OK
  • Red Hot Chilli Peppers - superb, best there

We continued our holiday in Dorset

Daddy met up with Ellie and Michael. He also saw great cousins Sarah and Paul. These are the bands they watched

  • Eisley - never heard of them before, but loved their music - surprise package of the weekend
  • Echo And The Bunneymen - absolute rubbish
  • The Cardigans - Alright
  • Athlete - superb, just hope they make it in the big time
  • Ash - was looking forward to them, but couldn't get in to them at the festival
  • Foo Fighters - carnage, got right to the front and spent most of my time fending people off and not listening to the music - lesson learnt
  • Feeder - real gut wrench, coz Coldplay who were biggest band in the world were on the other stage - any way they done well.

Mummy, Auntie Charlotte and I went down to Dorset to meet the rest of mummy's side of the family.

Daddy went to the Virgin V-Festival with Nick and Martin in Chelmsford. They camped for the whole weekend
Went to visit Great Uncle Bob. He wasn't very well. We then went to see baby Cameron

title.value: My first full day at home

info.content:
Mummy and Daddy drove me home from hospital. I think it was the most careful that dad has ever driven.

Close up and personal

first.name: katie
first.value: My first appearance to the world

info.content:
Yippee! At last after waiting an extra 8 days, I finally popped in an appearance. Here are my vitals:-

  • WhereFrimley Park Hospital
  • Weight8lbs 12oz
  • Height53.3
  • EyesDark Blue
  • Present At BirthMummy of course, Daddy and Mary Lim (Midwife)

First cuddle with mummy

Mummy holding me
Mormor came over awaiting our new arrival.

In the morning we went to watch Ellie and Rachel compete in the run for life at Blackheath

We then drove up to Minster where Michael and I were doing a spot of wind surfing.

We returned all 4 of us to Gravesend Park for a BBQ.

title.value: Run For Life, Windsurfing, BBQ In The Park

info.content:
We went over and walked around the picturesque towns of Henley and Wallingford. Always remember the underage drinking under Wallingford bridge. 13 year olds drunk!!

Some of the boys went to Prague to see Gary marry Zuzzi.

Mart had organised for us to go down to Newquay for Gary's stag do over a long weekend.

Participants were: Myself, Martin, Michael, Nick, Gary, Barrie

List of memorable things:

  • The massive split in my tyre before we left Frimley
  • 100mph+ on the A30 in Devon
  • Martin's M4/M5 route
  • Martin taking us off at Avonmouth for a scenic shortcut around an industrial estate.
  • Bazza on the phone to Gazza. 'My Bagggg'
  • Sunnyside campsite
  • The stripper before Gazza's.
  • Gazza's small bits
  • The Highcliff hotel afternoon
  • Gazza's bad stripper
  • The phone disappeared somewhere didn't it Gaz?
  • Late night with the campers
  • Beach football
We went sailing with Laura's parents. I managed persuade Gerry to give me a toe. I was being dragged along the Medway on a tyre. It seemed quite fast. We stayed overnight at Queenborough.
We went to Bournemouth today. It’s my favourite place. Somewhere I wouldn't mind living. Anyhow Lau relaxed on the beach, whilst I went in for a dip. The water wasn't too bad.

title.value: A Day Out At The Seaside

info.content:
A day at the races. Work hired a corporate tent where we had a meal and a few beverages. Afterwards we went to the race course and had a few bets. Some winners, some losers.

It all turned out predictable in the end. Trevor got drunk, Whitey got loud and Dilley got rich!

In the afternoon we went over to Tilford to play in the river, had a picnic and relaxed watching the cricket.

We went over to the evening part of Paul and Hayley's wedding over in Painshill Park, Cobham. It was nice to see some old faces.

title.value: Tilford and Paul and Hayley's Wedding

info.content: We went over to Shirley and Michael's for a family re-union. I saw my Uncle Ron for the first time. He was a tall and very nice man. A gentle giant. There was a lot of distant relatives there, mainly the Southgate's. Alan, Linda and Sharon were there as well which was nice to see.
Fi, Kelly, William, Helen, Vicky and Jessica came over for a BBQ. Ended a bit sloppy on some of my cocktails.
We trundled over to Thetford forest for a nice walk. We stopped off for a Hungry Horse.

We spent the weekend with Ellie and Michael camping in Lawshall just south of Bury St Edmunds.

We went to visit Laura's cousin Sarah, in her house in Theftford. It was a nice new build house. They seemed really well set-up there.

In the evening we made our way up to Swaffham to watch the banger racing.
We went over to Karen and Richards for a murder mystery evening. It was a lot of fun. We had to dress up as our characters. I think I was a pilot.
We went down to Malvern and went to a massive Gardening show/stalls thing. We went off to Worcester to mooch about the lovely town..
We booked a weekend in Coventry. On the way up we stopped off in Leamington Spa for some dinner and a walk around the town.

In the morning we went to Cascades and played golf with Ellie and Michael.

We went over to Helens for the evening for a meal and murder mystery night. We learnt Uncle Michael can't read!!.
We had a presentation night for Casuals down at the Nightingale in Ash.

title.value: Old Boys Game and Casuals Presentation Night

info.content: I went along with Dad to Reigate, where he picked up a long service award for his work with Chertsey. I was very proud of him.
We went up with Charlotte to Woburn Safari park.
We went to see some off road 4x4 racing up on the ranges by Red Road.

We went with Ellie and Michael to visit Vicky in Penarth.

We went to the beach at Llantwit Major. I got told off for climbing the cliffs!

We had a card night over at Johnny Bakers house.

A memorable comment from Stevey Barnett was, "So, are you still a student", inferring the house was in such bad condition that John lived in a student house.

It wasn't too memorable for me as I was completely ratted by about 9 o'clock. Past that time I cannot remember anything. I went out early within the first 45 minutes, and proceeded to drink 2 bottles of Amarula, pretty quickly. No joke.

Apparently I was very close to getting my head panned in, by a mad Samurai sword owning Irish man called Fonzy.

Well the boys told me to call him that, but he hates it. He's actually called Alfonso. Anyway at one point he climbed over the sofa's to go and get a drink and pushed him onto the sofa, and laughed at him, as drunks do! The room fell silent, there was tension in the air, and he must have contemplated in giving me a smacking. Anyway he didn't, but a close thing.

Two bottles surely not me!

I was havoc. John was just following me around making sure I didn't cause too much damage/chaos. I collapsed by the front door. I finally slept on the first floor landing. One of Johns female housemates, rang from her room to John, to say I was sounding a bit ill. I think she was scared to pass me on the landing. I managed to hurl up, a number of times in Johns bathroom. I sprayed their bathroom. I tried very hard to clear it up. The floor the sink, the toilet. The carpet bit around the toilet was ruined where I didn't really aim right. I gave John a fiver in the morning to get a replacement.

Nick drove my car home the morning afterwards, as I was still drunk!!

See a video here of the night's proceedings.

20 week scan - 1

20 week scan - 2
We went up with Ellie and Michael to the Ideal Home Exhibition. Don't remember buying much other than a bottle of Amarula.
Laura had organised with her Anthony Nolan group another barn dance at the Balmoral Road Community Centre. We had a real nice time.

It was just Dad and I who were the removal men. Although, I had been preparing for us to move for the past few weeks, there was lots of work still to do.

We managed to hire a transit at a reasonable cost (something like £80), I think it took 2 trips. It was a well organised and slick operation. Dad and I put a lot of hard work into it all.

Our new house, was NEW. Off white walls and carpets, nice new fitted kitchen, Just a few snags, but otherwise we were ready to move our stuff straight away without having to worry about decorating too much.

Mum and Susan came over later on and we all had Fish and Chips for dinner.
We went over to Eashing for a pub meal with Ellie and Michael. It was our first view of baby Ella.

We went up to London to see the James Bond exhibition. There were many of his gadgets and cars there.

We stayed up there in the evening and had a meal at our, now traditional Topo Gigio.

A few of us (William, Karen, Richard, Helen) went down to Brighton for the day. We mooched around the town, beach and pier.

In the evening we went to Jess and John party which was held in the Conservative Club. It was quite a strange party. This very grand building, hidden away in a dead road. We had to buzz to get in! There was a disco in the back room. We didn't know anyone else there, except for one of Laura's old school friend (Jess's best friend). I enjoyed it as like something a little bit different.
David and Louise got married today. It was a quiet affair with family only.
We went out with our sisters and partners to the Tex-Mex Hardy's in Bagshot to celebrate Laura's pregnancy. We had a good time.
12 week scan

We trekked our way down to Lullworth Cove. We made the walk west. The weather was great, really windy, difficult to get up the hill, slight drizzle in the air, but not too cold. We had fun anyway. We came back and ended up having a lovely cuppa in the cafe on the waterfront.
